title: Learning Path: Nanite LOD
ai_summary: The user is experiencing issues related to Nanite, Unreal Engine 5's virtualized micropolygon geometry system, likely concerning performance, visual fidelity, or workflow integration.
ai_what_you_learn: Enable Nanite on static mesh assets by right-clicking in the Content Browser, selecting 'Import to Nanite', or enabling 'Build Nanite' in the Static Mesh Editor.
Use the 'Nanite Visualization' modes (e.g., 'Triangle Count', 'Material ID') in the viewport to diagnose performance and visual issues.
Understand that Nanite is best suited for static meshes with high polygon counts and complex details; avoid using it on simple, low-poly objects.
Be mindful of Nanite's limitations with dynamic geometry and certain material effects, requiring alternative solutions for those cases.

steps.title: Step 1: Understand the Basics of Nanite
steps.description:
Understanding the core concepts of Nanite is crucial before troubleshooting specific issues. This step introduces what Nanite is and how it fundamentally changes the way geometry is handled in Unreal Engine.

👉 **Action:** Watch the 'What is virtualized micropolygon geometry?' video to grasp the core concepts of Nanite.

steps.title: Step 2: Diagnose Your Issue with Nanite Visualizations
steps.description:
Once you understand the basics, you need to be able to diagnose what's going wrong. Unreal Engine provides visualization tools specifically for Nanite. This step focuses on using these tools to identify performance bottlenecks or visual artifacts.

👉 **Action:** Watch the 'Nanite | Inside Unreal' video and look for the section on Nanite Visualizations.

content.description:

steps.title: Step 3: Applying Nanite to Assets and Troubleshooting Common Problems
steps.description:
After diagnosing the issue, you can proceed to apply the correct resolution. This might involve enabling Nanite on an asset, adjusting import settings, or understanding limitations that require alternative solutions.

👉 **Action:** Watch the 'Nanite for Artists | GDC 2024' video to learn about best practices for applying Nanite to assets and troubleshooting common issues. Pay special attention to the parts about performance and visual quality.

steps.title: Step 4: Understanding Advanced Features and Limitations for Future Prevention
steps.description:
To prevent future issues, it's important to understand the advanced features and limitations of Nanite. This step will explore tessellation and situations where Nanite might not be the best choice, guiding you towards alternative solutions.

👉 **Action:** Watch the 'Unreal Engine 5.4 Nanite Tessellation' video to understand how tessellation interacts with Nanite and the limitations of Nanite with dynamic meshes.

content.title: Unreal Engine 5.4 Nanite Tessellation
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video highlights the new tessellation features in UE 5.4 and provides insights into how Nanite handles complex geometry. Understanding tessellation helps prevent issues related to silhouette quality and level of detail.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Watch the entire video for a comprehensive overview of Nanite Tessellation. (7 minutes)
